fields.description:
Current Hosted Jira Subversion Repository doesn't allow access to needed to tools and custom hook scripts.  This is a needed item that no SCM'r should be restricted from.  

As a career long SCM'r I couldn't recommend (and will recommend against) using the Atlassian hosted Subversion solution as tools which are needed in daily work aren't provided.

This specific request is to have an interface created that allows for specific additions to the hooks directory and usage of repository-only tools (such as svnlook).

Please provide your SCM consultants with a way to use these excellent tools, external (as you won't allow direct access) to the Jira environment.
fields.summary: Jira Studio Hosted Subversion needs interface to work with repository based tools

fields.description:
I'm just filing this so we remember to fix it.

This could have been caused by the confluence upgrade. It may be solved by releasing a new version of streams built against confluence 3.4.2. 

Confirmed against studio running conf 3.4.2 with stream 3.4.3 and 3.4.4.
fields.summary: Cannot send comments to confluence over streams

fields.description: Studio's AUI is very old. We're still on v1, bu AUI is on 3+.
fields.summary: Remove AUI overrides

fields.description:
The PAC check was implemented as a Maven plugin in AOD-3243. The work on that had to be finished off early since the issue is moved out of the iteration. The plugin works but should be polished as the comments in the code and in CR-AOD-310 suggest.

A build plan has been set up to run these validations, see https://bamboo.extranet.atlassian.com/browse/SFT-PACCHECK/

It works for JIRA and Confluence, but f.e. Crowd doesn't work since the Studio SNAPSHOT deps are not satisfied. This plan should not produce and install these artifacts, instead it should rely on the artifacts being produced by https://bamboo.extranet.atlassian.com/browse/SFT-STUDIO/latest.
fields.summary: Polish PAC up-to-date check and ensure that the BEAC plan is working

fields.description: While spiking the upgrade, ensure that all steps are documented with the intention of automating this process.
fields.summary: Ensure upgrade process is documented with the intent of automation

fields.description: While implementing the upgrade, ensure the documentation for the upgrade process is updated so we can automate it.
fields.summary: Update documentation to allow for automated upgrades

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 17 September 2014|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hi everyone,
 
Thanks so much for your votes and comments on this issue.
 
Atlassian is working hard on Atlassian Connect, Atlassian's strategic integration platform enabling ecosystem vendors to develop add-ons for Atlassian Cloud (OnDemand). Atlassian Connect 1.0 [was released in March 2014|http://blogs.atlassian.com/2014/03/introducing-atlassian-connect-1-0/], and you can already get access to [more than 50 public add-ons today built using the platform|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/search?application=&category=&cost=&hosting=cloud&marketingLabel=].
 
Due to stability and scalability reasons, we will not bundle additional third party add-ons with our Cloud offerings. But you should feel free to contact the vendors of your favourite add-ons to let them know that you would like them to create a Cloud version of the add-on! We will do our best to work together with the vendor to satisfy this request.
 
Since we have no plans to bundle additional add-ons in Cloud, we are closing this issue.
 
Cheers,
Bartek
JIRA Product Management
bartek (at) atlassian (dot) com
{panel}
 
 
*Original request description:*
zAgile Wikidsmart plugin support for the Confluence Wiki in Studio
http://www.zagile.com/3/download.html
fields.summary: zAgile Wikidsmart for the Wiki

fields.summary: Flaky test: GappsTestGroupSetup

fields.description:
We are using a single agent elastic bamboo instance with Auto-mount EBS volume everytime option. But, as opposed to the description, it doesn't mounts the EBS volume (the one mounted last time) and creates a fresh EBS from the snapshot.

This makes sense for those using many agents configuration, but, for several developers with a single agent license, the same EBS volume must be used instead on creating a fresh one every time.

I mean that there should be an option for this at least. Currently, I assume the process is as follows:

1) Create a EBS volume from the snapshot (snapshotId is provided in configuration) and get its volumeId.
2) Mount the volumeId to the new instance.

I propose that it should be modified as:
1) Ask for a snapshotId and a EBS volumeId(s) in elastic bamboo instance configuration and keep those in record.
2) Launch a new instance and check if a volumeId provided is valid and not mounted already, and if its free, mount it to the new instance and if none of the volumeId(s) is valid and free, create a new volume from the snapshotId, get newly created volumeId and mount it.
3) Optional: Update the newly created volumeId in record (array) for reuse.

I think the option to reuse the existing EBS volume (the same which was used last time) may be provided easily in the elastic bamboo, at least for those using a single instance and this will be of great help for many customers.

Thanks & Regards
fields.summary: Capability to reuse the existing EBS volume by elastic bamboo instead on creating a fresh volume everytime from the snapshot

fields.description:
Visiting a code review URL in StAC, such as https://studio.atlassian.com/source/cru/CR-AOD-304, brings us to the FishEye login form instead of the JIRA login form, and a JavaScript error is thrown:
{code}
Error: document.loginform.username is undefined
Source File: https://studio.atlassian.com/source/cru/CR-AOD-304
Line: 38
{code}

It was known that this happens in IE7 and Firefox 3.6.

Please see screenshot [^fisheye-login.png].
fields.summary: Accessing code review URL leads to fisheye login form with JavaScript error

2) go to http://localhost:1990/wiki/plugins/servlet/upm
3) the jira login page is shown, note that the url is http://localhost:2990/jira/login.jsp?os_destination=%2Fwikihttp%3A%2F%2Flocalhost%3A1990%2Fwiki%2Fplugins%2Fservlet%2Fupm
4) log in
5) redirected to http://localhost:2990/jira/wikihttp://localhost:1990/wiki/plugins/servlet/upm

fields.description:
We use JIRA for alot. We have internal and client collaboration on it. The term ISSUES as the main nav item is confusing, considering we plan our roadmaps and have items like designs or mockups on features/user stories.

It would be great of these items could be considered project ITEMS or some other common name, not issues. Issues are seemingly a misnomer... would love to change it, or be able to edit it, as we can add custom tabs, but not the subsections.
fields.summary: Allow rename of 'ISSUES' to 'ITEMS' or something else, not all items are ISSUES, it confuses clients.
Removing svn permissions for root will stop bamboo checkouts.

fields.description:
The main thing that relies on Confluence WebDAV is the Office Connector.  With Confluence 3.3.x, Confluence now has CAPTCHA.  Somehow, some users on other instances have locked themselves out of Confluence and this blocks them from authenticating properly against WebDAV so the Office Connector - Edit in Office - doesn't work.

There needs to be a way for JIRA Studio administrators to reset the failed login counter or JIRA Studio should ship with Confluence's CAPTCHA disabled.

Current workarounds include raising a ticket to have support disable Confluence's CAPTCHA.  Alternatively we can run this SQL against the Confluence db:

update os_propertyentry set int_val = '0' where entity_key='user.login.current_number_failed_login_attempts';
fields.summary: Users can lock themselves out of using Confluence's WebDAV which breaks everything that relies on that component
As a Studio developer, I want to know what changes need to be made to the application to deploy onto the Unicorn platform

fields.description:
When you try and apply a patch three things can happen:

# The patch can succeed without flaw.
# The patch can fail miserably.
# The patch can succeed but some shifting was required to make it work. It was not a clean patch.

For the last scenario JST-MVN should update the patch files for us and give us the result back so that we can put that back in studio. Also, if any patch fails then that should break the build, all patches should pass completely (no Hunk fails) before continuing the build.
fields.summary: The JST MVN project should update patches for us if it can.

{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 17 September 2014|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hi everyone,
 
Thanks so much for your votes and comments on this issue.
 
Atlassian is working hard on Atlassian Connect, Atlassian's strategic integration platform enabling ecosystem vendors to develop add-ons for Atlassian Cloud (OnDemand). Atlassian Connect 1.0 [was released in March 2014|http://blogs.atlassian.com/2014/03/introducing-atlassian-connect-1-0/], and you can already get access to [more than 50 public add-ons today built using the platform|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/search?application=&category=&cost=&hosting=cloud&marketingLabel=].
 
Due to stability and scalability reasons, we will not bundle additional third party add-ons with our Cloud offerings. But you should feel free to contact the vendors of your favourite add-ons to let them know that you would like them to create a Cloud version of the add-on! We will do our best to work together with the vendor to satisfy this request.
 
Since we have no plans to bundle additional add-ons in Cloud, we are closing this issue.
 
Cheers,
Bartek
JIRA Product Management
bartek (at) atlassian (dot) com
{panel}
 
 
*Original request description:*
https://plugins.atlassian.com/plugin/details/5295

Including functional tests, admin links, etc.

We'll need to ensure it is updated for Confluence 3.4.

fields.description:
Add a step to the com.atlassian.maven.plugins.studio.war.PackageWarMojo (com.atlassian.maven.plugins:studio) in order to check if the most recent released version of an additionally (for Studio, including GApps) bundled plugin is used. This can be either done by requesting Nexus or PAC. Ideally that should be done in a separate Mojo and PackageWarMojo could just delegate to it. It should not be bound to a phase before package since the operation will require quite some time. It should be possible to disable (property, default activated) the delegate in PackageWarMojo for the same reason. The new Mojo should log warnings by default if a more recent version is found, but it should be possible to configure it (property) to throw an exception which aggregated(!) the result of the check if failed.

See also Tim's original comment:
https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/AOD-1765?focusedCommentId=33620&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels%3Acomment-tabpanel#action_33620

Some details regarding the package-war goal:
https://studio.atlassian.com/wiki/display/JST/Product+Upgrade+in+Studio+2.x
fields.summary: Automate up-to-date check for bundled plugins
Bundle the JIRA Workflow Visualization plugin

fields.description:
This ticket is the next step after AOD-2579.

Collaborators Administrators should not have access to Fisheye/Crucible/Bamboo admin pages.

Collaborator admin trying to edit source permission receives error:
{{The SVN repository auth file cannot be read. Please contact a system administrator.}}
fields.summary: Collaborator administrators have access to Fisheye admin pages

fields.description:
To illustrate, check this setting:

!settings.png!

and check the end result:

!header.png!

(In the second picture, the cursor is actually hovering on Builds tab).

This concludes that:

* Header Text Colour is not applied to the tabs
* Header Text Highlight Colour is mistakenly applied to non-hovered tabs
* Header Text Highlight Colour is not applied to hovered tabs
fields.summary: Header Text/Text Highlight Colour is not respected

fields.description:
Currently, the _bamboo-svn-user is granted with read-only permission for Subversion repository. Sometimes, this user may require a write permission (e.g to run a "mvn release:prepare release:perform").

Changing the authz file to grant this write permission may:

* not be wise since it will allow the user to perform anything on the repository
* cause it to be overwritten when someone modified permissions via SVN permission manager in Studio
fields.summary: Allow _bamboo-svn-user to write to SVN

fields.description: The default implementation of Permission Service does discriminate sysadmin and admin. However, it allows admin to disable/enable any system plugin.
fields.summary: Provide a UPM Permission Service implementation in studio-theme-confluence-plugin
Set up a Bamboo plan on BEAC running WebDriver tests with MSIE8
Set up a Bamboo plan on BEAC running WebDriver tests with Firefox

fields.description: Confirm that the test written in AOD-3222 can run in Firefox on a dev build.
fields.summary: Allow the WebDriver back-end to be specified in the POM

fields.description:
Using WebDriver, write a test for each application that logs in and visits the app tab.

This should run with the HtmlUnit back-end.
fields.summary: Create a basic WebDriver smoke test
Spike WebDriver Tests
Investigate UPM permissions SPI

*Original request description:*
As per [this documentation|https://studio.atlassian.com/wiki/display/JST/Plugins] I'm requesting the [CustomWare Visibility Plugin|https://plugins.atlassian.com/plugin/details/202] to be bundled for this SAC ticket: [AOD-11964|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JST-11964]. Please evaluate this plugin and consider it for bundling.

Thanks,

Dennis
fields.summary: Please install CustomWare Visibility Plugin.

fields.description:
Note that Bamboo has some key terminology changes.  

AT RELEASE:

For Studio 2.4 this means that the docs need to point to BAMBOO.
fields.summary: JIRA Studio 2.4 docs. Check glossary items that refer to Bamboo
Spike: different options for per-user access

fields.description: Studio talks about the link hiearchy plugin in the config, but its not installed. Would like it.
fields.summary: Include Link Hiearchy Plugin with Jira Studio

fields.description:
FE should still have a poll time, but it would be lengthened.
Commits would trigger an instant FE poll of the relevant repository, provided one is not already running.
We *should* see performance improvements, which would benefit support. I don't yet know what these would be.
fields.summary: Use post commit hooks to notify FE of commits
